intro: Keraselma oleraceum, commonly known as the common keravel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Keraselma oleraceum is often found in grassy areas, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
